name: overmedicated
text: Never in human, or indeed cat history, has the relationship been summed up so accurately.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: No joke.

name: saint
text:
we get by.

wow.

name: senseihollywood
text: great one, but does "slice, slice" count as onomatopoeia?

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by littlecat, Deusoma, 7th_shot, ohmygooses, Audhumla)

name: spinynorman
text:
It's an actual word. If it were like "shhhhthut" then it would be one.

Size has nothing to with it. "Sha-DOOOM-rumbleumbleumble", being the sound of a ship carrying refined oil catching fire and exploding, is a perfectly acceptable onomatopoeia.

name: ferdinand
text: A comment left by ferdinand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ohmygooses, hearshot, bluecarrot, andrew_k)

name: spinynorman
text:
I'm going to reference the 60's Batman show fight scenes now. It was

POW

BIFF

but never PUNCH or HIT IN THE FACE

name: saru
text:
"Hit in the face" probably isn't an onomatopoeia (even if it might be used as such for ironic effect), but punch might be.
The Batman show chose its onomatopoeias for specific effect, that doesn't mean they necessarily define the available field.

name: tangram
text: The all time best was "BARROOM!" Specifically for fights in discos and such.

name: goatmasterflash
text:
What's the difference between Smoke and an elephant fart?

Smoke is a bar room, whereas an elephant fart is more of a "BARROOM!"

name: fattypneumonia
text: Groan-worthy, but chubbed for the avatar.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
MEET A FIST!!

*ckk*
she killed my dog.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: YES.

name: vulpes-aurum
text: No, wait, I meant, "Uuuuuuuuuuuuuumkay."

name: soticoto
text: Instant chubby for referencing Adam West's Batman.

name: rowboat
text: Spiny is so desperately trying to talk sense to these people. Man, sometimes you just have to accept that someone just believes that they're right and can't be bothered to learn the truth about things. Valiant effort, though.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh, SpinyNorman. I think I have a crush on you.

name: spinynorman
text: My coworker has no idea why I just high-fived him.

name: heccibiggs
text:
My family will have no idea why I'm waking them up with my laughter.

(Hello, time difference.)

name: aliiis
text: But who needs 'slice' to be accepted as onomatopoeia when you have splup sklurgh ?!

name: direhaggis
text: And like waiting day after day for a soldier to return from war, still we have not seen the chicken recipe. Cheeky alt text.

text: ALT TEXT: Tomorrow's recipe: Chicken!

name: cailetshadow
text: Someday Onstad is going to have an alt text that reads, "Yesterday's recipe: Chicken!" and many loyal readers will suffer an instantaneous mental breakdown.

text: What the hell???

name: _cheesekayke
text: it never is lupus, Dr. House. It never is.

name: farqussus
text: You are insults are my secret shame.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I tend to go for "I'll _____ you in a minute!"

Like,
"Shut up and do the vacuuming."
"I'll vacuum you in a minute!"

That's one of the more logical ones.

name: farqussus
text: I like them too

name: i_love_kate
text: Same, but I tend to eschew the "In a minute" part. More aerodynamic.

name: goatmasterflash
text: "I'll show you a _______. Bend over"

name: atticusonline
text: What if someone said "Fuck you!" ?

name: farqussus
text:
"I'll fuck you in a minute"

Simple.

name: farqussus
text:
Or Your Mum fucked you.

Or I'll fuck you. Bend over.

name: atticusonline
text: I'll show you a fuck! Bend over!

name: farqussus
text: yeah that one's better

name: atticusonline
text: Thanks, I had to practice for a few days to get it right.

name: all-star951
text:
I usually say "Your face _____"

Your face will do the vacuuming

name: greenkoolayd
text: when those types of replies work against you, is it funny or sad?

name: quaga
text:
Mine are of the tacking on "your mom" variety, but never in a way that would be obscene or could pass as an actual insult.

Example: "Hey, could you stop by the grocery store after work?"
"Your Mom went to the grocery store!"

I then ask if they can feel the burn (they can't)

name: goatmasterflash
text:
Man, never get embroiled in a battle of "your moms".
Let the other person get one "your mom" in and then reply, "I don't have a mother. Me and my dad share yours."

name: _cheesekayke
text: Thank you, stealing that.

name: doubleclef
text: A comment left by doubleclef was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by salo, tourach3, relaxing, Anderian, gbeaton)

name: hyetal
text: Simply brilliant.

name: bluecarrot
text: So good then?

name: jeet
text:
The exaggerated answer kind of reminds me of Zits.

Oh dang I just compared Achewood to a newspaper comic. At least it's a relatively good newspaper comic.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Agreed on both counts. Though I'm not a Zits fan or anything, it's hard to dislike...even if my parents still say "this guy is just like you!"

name: farqussus
text:
My mind jumped to Zit Remedy.

Everybody wants something. They take your money, and you know what else? They never give up.

name: dasuta
text: so it goes.

name: unsentletter
text:
I love this comic. Especially the wry final line and the splup sklurgh .

Re-reading it, I was reminded of this... it's called "it feels like this": [img src= http://www.jenwang.net/art/images/itfeelslikethis.jpg]

by Jen Wang

Both pieces hurt in familiar ways.
